title.narrative: Teaching Life Skills and Sex Education from Developmental Perspective

mailing-address.narrative: P.O. Box 29777, 2502 LT The Hague, The Netherlands

title.narrative: Project photo
Narrative report

description.narrative: Reporting is an important management tool which is used to inform relevant government officials and other stakeholders about the results being achieved by individual projects and the programme as a whole. For project partners, it is compulsory to use the prescribed Orange Knowledge annual report format in order to report on project achievements. The annual report also provides valuable data on the financial situation of the project. Based on an analysis of the project performance in relation to the project output(s) and expected outcome(s), a revision of the project work plan may be suggested by the project partners. The consequences of a possible revision on the project work plan and budget must be made clear in the annual report. Nuffic monitors outputs and outcomes and not activities. Therefore, the main focus of the annual report must be on the achievement of the project’s output(s) and planned outcome(s). The information provided in the annual reports of the projects is used by Nuffic to monitor the progress of the project and to inform the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other stakeholders about the output(s) and outcome(s) being achieved by individual projects and the Orange Knowledge programme as a whole. Please note that if project progress is in accordance with the original planning, reporting requirements are minimal. Only in case of deviations from the planning, more elaboration is demanded. In the Grant Obligations and Conditions, the obligatory dates for submission of the annual/additional reports are mentioned. The final report must reflect on the entire project period.

title.narrative: 14. Final report TMT+/TMT

description.narrative:
Final conclusions TMT+/TMT (in case of final report) Reflect on how the training has contributed to addressing the capacity needs as described by the requesting organisation in the proposal form. How effective and efficient has the TMT+ been in reaching the desired objectives? Please formulate lessons learned and recommendations for the post-project period.
+
In your email submitting the final report, the partners will enclose: - an inventory of equipment purchased - a document signed by the (Lead partner) Dutch consortium/provider and Lead partner consortium country A or requesting organisation on the transfer of ownership - a list with the names and email addresses of staff members who participated in staff training for their registration in the Holland Alumni Network database

title.narrative: 2. Project progress and achievement

description.narrative:
In this section (maximum 1000 words), please
**For TMT+:**
Comment to what extent the outputs have been achieved. Comment on the activities that have taken place and the most important milestones.

title.narrative: II. Partnerships between persons and organisations are inclusive and sustainable
II.P.8. Number of staff of Dutch training education organisations that have gained new insights and ways of working

comment.narrative: Besides the two consultants, Elly van der Gouwe and Janneke Zoeten, also the teamleader Sjoerd van den Berg has been gaining new insights in ways of working with parthers like AMG Philippines. These concern the content on Life Skills in the Philippine context and besides that the way AMG follows the train-the-trainer concept in reaching the heads of the care centers.

Besides the two consultants, Elly van der Gouwe and Janneke Zoeten, also the teamleader Sjoerd van den Berg has been gaining new insights in ways of working with parthers like AMG Philippines. These concern the content on Life Skills in the Philippine context and besides that the way AMG follows the train-the-trainer concept in reaching the heads of the care centers.

title.narrative: II.P.7. Number of Dutch training education organisations that have improved their training methods

comment.narrative: Driestar Christian University will improve its training methods by means of the TMT. Woord and Daad has been a partner of AMG Philippines for quite some time and plays therefore a role of advice but not as provider of training methods. That is up to Driestar only.

Driestar Christian University will improve its training methods by means of the TMT. Woord and Daad has been a partner of AMG Philippines for quite some time and plays therefore a role of advice but not as provider of training methods. That is up to Driestar only.

title.narrative: II.P.5. Number of academic staff of partner country still cooperates with academic staff of other education organisation(s)

comment.narrative: In total 38 heads of the care centers will be trained. They will be part of a follow-up activity in order to be sure of an effective implementation by the heads at one hand, and of new learning points for Driestar trainings in the future at the other hand. The additional person is the coordinator of AMG Philippines.

In total 38 heads of the care centers will be trained. They will be part of a follow-up activity in order to be sure of an effective implementation by the heads at one hand, and of new learning points for Driestar trainings in the future at the other hand. The additional person is the coordinator of AMG Philippines.

title.narrative: II.P.1. Number of MoUs or other types of formal collaboration agreements exist 1, 3, 5 years after end of project

comment.narrative: There will be no additional MoU's as a result of this TMT. The partnership between Woord en Daad and AMG at one hand, and between Driestar and Woord and Daad at the other hand will just continue by means of existing MoU's.

title.narrative: Better information and protective behaviour against risks of (sex)trafficking
- Number of young people reached with age-appropriate, comprehensive, correct information on risks of sexual exploitation and trafficking and developed protective behaviors.

description.narrative: 80% [1600 out of 2000] of children and youth in AMG centers are taught life-skills (incl. sex-ed and protective behavior.) in the 38 AMG centers

title.narrative: SRHR.4 More respect for the sexual and reproductive rights of groups who are currently denied these rights
SRHR.4.1. Whether and how SRHR frameworks have been adopted and incorporated into national policies (current and observable changes)

description.narrative: please include here stories of change, best practices and project-related examples

title.narrative: B. Enhanced knowledge and skills of individuals and organisations (in partner countries and in the NL) in line with country/regional specific labour market needs & aiming at inclusiveness
B.O.1. Number of organisations strengthened by individual and/or group training
B.O.2. % of alumni / TMT participants who have applied the acquired knowledge and skills within their working environment
B.I.1. Number of scholarship holders / TMT participants that have successfully completed course/training (male / female / minorities)
B.I.8. % alumni / TMT participants who state that they have acquired new knowledge and skills; e.g. problem solving, effective communication
SRHR.1 Better information and greater freedom of choice for young people about their sexuality
SRHR.1.2. Number of young people reached with comprehensive, correct information on sexuality, HIV/AIDS, STIs, pregnancy and contraception
III. Organisations key to (sectoral) inclusive development of partner countries are strengthened by inflow of enhanced workforce
III.I.1. % of alumni who state that they have applied in their workplace the knowledge and skills gained from the interventions
III.O.3. % employers that states that their department/organisation has become more effective because of OKP intervention
III.I.3. Narratives from alumni on policy and procedural changes, inclusive development, and innovations as a result of interventions
III.O.4. Testimonials from employers on organisational changes (implemented procedure/techniques, work ethic etc.) due to trained staff (critical mass)
